00016 class BoolAndLattice : public FiniteLattice
00017 {
00018         // state can be:
00019         // -1 : unset (default value)
00020         // 0 : false
00021         // 1 : true
00022         int state;
00023         
00024         public:
00025         BoolAndLattice()
00026         { state = -1; }
00027         
00028         private:
00029         BoolAndLattice(int state)
00030         { this->state = state; }
00031         
00032         public:
00033         BoolAndLattice(bool state)
00034         { this->state = state; }
00035         
00036         // initializes this Lattice to its default state
00037         void initialize()
00038         { state = -1; }
00039         
00040         // returns a copy of this lattice
00041         Lattice* copy() const;
00042         
00043         // overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00044         void copy(Lattice* that);
00045         
00046         // computes the meet of this and that and saves the result in this
00047         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00048         bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that);
00049         
00050         // computes the meet of this and that and returns the result
00051         //Lattice* meet(Lattice* that);
00052                 
00053         bool operator==(Lattice* that);
00054         
00055         // returns the current state of this object
00056         bool get() const;
00057         
00058         // sets the state of this BoolAndLattice to the given value
00059         // returns true if this causes the BoolAndLattice state to change, false otherwise
00060         bool set(bool state);
00061         
00062         // sets the state of this lattice to the conjunction of the BoolAndLattice's current state and the given value
00063         // returns true if this causes the BoolAndLattice state to change, false otherwise
00064         bool andUpd(bool state);
00065         
00066         // Functions used to inform this lattice that a given variable is now in use (e.g. a variable has entered 
00067         //    scope or an expression is being analyzed) or is no longer in use (e.g. a variable has exited scope or
00068         //    an expression or variable is dead).
00069         // It is assumed that a newly-added variable has not been added before and that a variable that is being
00070         //    removed was previously added
00071         // These are empty in this lattice since it is now explicitly aware of variables.
00072         /*void addVar(varID var) {};
00073         void remVar(varID var) {};*/
00074         
00075         std::string str(std::string indent="");
00076 };

00078 class IntMaxLattice : public InfiniteLattice
00079 {
00080         int state;
00081         
00082         public:
00083         static const int infinity;// = 32768;
00084         
00085         IntMaxLattice()
00086         {
00087                 state = -1;
00088         }
00089         
00090         IntMaxLattice(int state)
00091         {
00092                 this->state = state;
00093         }
00094         
00095         // initializes this Lattice to its default state
00096         void initialize()
00097         {
00098                 state = -1;
00099         }
00100         
00101         // returns a copy of this lattice
00102         Lattice* copy() const;
00103         
00104         // overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00105         void copy(Lattice* that);

00108         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise

00115         
00116         // widens this from that and saves the result in this
00117         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00118         bool widenUpdate(InfiniteLattice* that);
00119         
00120         // returns the current state of this object
00121         int get() const;
00122         
00123         // sets the state of this lattice to the given value
00124         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00125         bool set(int state);
00126         
00127         // increments the state of this lattice by the given value
00128         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00129         bool incr(int increment);
00130         
00131         // computes the maximum of the given value and the state of this lattice and saves 
00132         //    the result in this lattice
00133         // returns true if this causes the lattice's state to change, false otherwise
00134         bool maximum(int value);
00135         
00136         // Functions used to inform this lattice that a given variable is now in use (e.g. a variable has entered 
00137         //    scope or an expression is being analyzed) or is no longer in use (e.g. a variable has exited scope or
00138         //    an expression or variable is dead).
00139         // It is assumed that a newly-added variable has not been added before and that a variable that is being
00140         //    removed was previously added
00141         // These are empty in this lattice since it is now explicitly aware of variables.
00142         /*void addVar(varID var) {};
00143         void remVar(varID var) {};*/
00144         
00145         std::string str(std::string indent="");
00146 };

00152 // A container lattice to store other lattices
00153 class ProductLattice : public virtual Lattice
00154 {
00155         public:
00156         // The different levels of this lattice
00157         static const int uninitialized=0; 
00158         static const int initialized=1; 
00159         // This object's current level in the lattice: (uninitialized or initialized)
00160         short level;
00161         
00162         protected:
00163         std::vector<Lattice*> lattices;
00164         
00165         public:
00166         ProductLattice();
00167         ProductLattice(const std::vector<Lattice*>& lattices);
00168         ~ProductLattice();
00169         
00170         void init(const std::vector<Lattice*>& lattices);
00171         
00172         // initializes this Lattice to its default state
00173         void initialize();
00174         
00175         const std::vector<Lattice*>& getLattices();
00176         
00177         // initializes the given vector with a copy of the lattices vector
00178         void copy_lattices(std::vector<Lattice*>& newLattices) const;
00179         
00180         // overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00181         virtual void copy(Lattice* that);
00182         
00183         // computes the meet of this and that and saves the result in this
00184         // returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise
00185         virtual bool meetUpdate(Lattice* that);
00186         
00187         virtual bool operator==(Lattice* that);
00188         
00189         int getLevel() { return level; }
00190         
00191         // Functions used to inform this lattice that a given variable is now in use (e.g. a variable has entered 
00192         //    scope or an expression is being analyzed) or is no longer in use (e.g. a variable has exited scope or
00193         //    an expression or variable is dead).
00194         // It is assumed that a newly-added variable has not been added before and that a variable that is being
00195         //    removed was previously added
00196         // These are empty in this lattice since it is now explicitly aware of variables.
00197         /*void addVar(varID var) {};
00198         void remVar(varID var) {};*/
00199         
00200         // The string that represents this object
00201         // If indent!="", every line of this string must be prefixed by indent
00202         // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00203         virtual std::string str(std::string indent="");
00204 };

00206 class FiniteProductLattice : public virtual ProductLattice, public virtual FiniteLattice
00207 {
00208         public:
00209         FiniteProductLattice() : ProductLattice(), FiniteLattice()
00210         {}
00211         
00212         FiniteProductLattice(const std::vector<Lattice*>& lattices) : ProductLattice(lattices), FiniteLattice()
00213         {
00214                 verifyFinite();
00215         }
00216         
00217         FiniteProductLattice(const FiniteProductLattice& that) : ProductLattice(that.lattices), FiniteLattice()
00218         {
00219                 verifyFinite();
00220         }
00221         
00222         void verifyFinite()
00223         {
00224                 for(std::vector<Lattice*>::iterator it = lattices.begin(); it!=lattices.end(); it++)
00225                                 ROSE_ASSERT((*it)->finiteLattice());
00226         }
00227         
00228         // Returns a copy of this lattice
00229         Lattice* copy() const
00230         {
00231                 return new FiniteProductLattice(*this);
00232         }
00233 };
00234 
00235 class InfiniteProductLattice : public virtual ProductLattice, public virtual InfiniteLattice
00236 {
00237         public:
00238         InfiniteProductLattice() : ProductLattice(), InfiniteLattice()
00239         {}
00240         
00241         InfiniteProductLattice(const std::vector<Lattice*>& lattices) : ProductLattice(lattices), InfiniteLattice()
00242         {}
00243         
00244         InfiniteProductLattice(const InfiniteProductLattice& that) : ProductLattice(that.lattices), InfiniteLattice()
00245         {}
00246         
00247         // returns a copy of this lattice
00248         Lattice* copy() const
00249         {
00250                 return new InfiniteProductLattice(*this);
00251         }
00252         
00253         // Widens this from that and saves the result in this.
00254         // Returns true if this causes this to change and false otherwise.
00255         bool widenUpdate(InfiniteLattice* that);
00256 };

00259 class VariablesProductLattice : public virtual ProductLattice
00260 {
00261     protected:
00262         // if =true, a lattice is created for each scalar variable
00263         bool includeScalars;
00264         // if =true, a lattice is created for each array variable 
00265         bool includeArrays;
00266         // the function that this lattice is associated with
00267         Function func;
00268         // map of lattices that correspond to constant variables, for quick search
00269         std::map<varID, Lattice*> constVarLattices;
00270         // lattice that corresponds to allVar;
00271         Lattice* allVarLattice;
00272         
00273         // sample lattice that will be initially associated with every variable (before the analysis)
00274         Lattice* perVarLattice;
00275         
00276         // maps variables in a given function to the index of their respective Lattice objects in 
00277         // the ProductLattice::lattice[] array
00278         static std::map<Function, std::map<varID, int> > varLatticeIndex;
00279         
00280     public:
00281         // creates a new VariablesProductLattice
00282         // includeScalars - if =true, a lattice is created for each scalar variable
00283         // includeArrays - if =true, a lattice is created for each array variable 
00284         // perVarLattice - sample lattice that will be associated with every variable in scope at node n
00285         //     it should be assumed that the object pointed to by perVarLattice will be either
00286         //     used internally by this VariablesProductLattice object or deallocated
00287         // constVarLattices - map of additional variables and their associated lattices, that will be 
00288         //     incorporated into this VariablesProductLattice in addition to any other lattices for 
00289         //     currently live variables (these correspond to various useful constant variables like zeroVar)
00290         // allVarLattice - the lattice associated with allVar (the variable that represents all of memory)
00291         //     if allVarLattice==NULL, no support is provided for allVar
00292         // func - the current function
00293         // n - the dataflow node that this lattice will be associated with
00294         // state - the NodeState at this dataflow node
00295         VariablesProductLattice(bool includeScalars, bool includeArrays, Lattice* perVarLattice, 
00296                                 const std::map<varID, Lattice*>& constVarLattices, Lattice* allVarLattice,
00297                                 const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state);
00298                                 
00299         // copy constructor
00300         VariablesProductLattice(const VariablesProductLattice& that);
00301         
00302     public:
00303         
00304         Lattice* getVarLattice(const Function& func, const varID& var);
00305         
00306     protected:
00307         // sets up the varLatticeIndex map, if necessary
00308         void setUpVarLatticeIndex();
00309         
00310         // returns the index of var among the variables associated with func
00311         // or -1 otherwise
00312         int getVarIndex(const Function& func, const varID& var);
00313         
00314     public:
00315         
00316         // returns the set of global variables(scalars and/or arrays)
00317         varIDSet& getGlobalVars() const;
00318         static varIDSet& getGlobalVars(bool includeScalars, bool includeArrays);
00319         
00320         // returns the set of variables(scalars and/or arrays) declared in this function
00321         varIDSet& getLocalVars(Function func) const;
00322         
00323         // returns the set of variables(scalars and/or arrays) referenced in this function
00324         varIDSet& getRefVars(Function func) const;
00325 
00326         // returns the set of variables(scalars and/or arrays) visible in this function
00327         varIDSet getVisibleVars(Function func) const;
00328         
00329         // returns a copy of this lattice
00330         //Lattice* copy() const;
00331         
00332         // overwrites the state of this Lattice with that of that Lattice
00333         void copy(Lattice* that);
00334         
00335         // Called by analyses to create a copy of this lattice. However, if this lattice maintains any 
00336         //    information on a per-variable basis, these per-variable mappings must be converted from 
00337         //    the current set of variables to another set. This may be needed during function calls, 
00338         //    when dataflow information from the caller/callee needs to be transferred to the callee/calleer.
00339         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00340         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00341         // varNameMap - maps all variable names that have changed, in each mapping pair, pair->first is the 
00342         //              old variable and pair->second is the new variable
00343         // func - the function that the copy Lattice will now be associated with
00344         /*Lattice**/void remapVars(const std::map<varID, varID>& varNameMap, const Function& newFunc);
00345         
00346         // Called by analyses to copy over from the that Lattice dataflow information into this Lattice.
00347         // that contains data for a set of variables and incorporateVars must overwrite the state of just
00348         // those variables, while leaving its state for other variables alone.
00349         // We do not force child classes to define their own versions of this function since not all
00350         //    Lattices have per-variable information.
00351         void incorporateVars(Lattice* that);    
00352         
00353         // Functions used to inform this lattice that a given variable is now in use (e.g. a variable has entered 
00354         //    scope or an expression is being analyzed) or is no longer in use (e.g. a variable has exited scope or
00355         //    an expression or variable is dead).
00356         // It is assumed that a newly-added variable has not been added before and that a variable that is being
00357         //    removed was previously added
00358         /*void addVar(varID var);
00359         void remVar(varID var);*/
00360         
00361         // The string that represents this object
00362         // If indent!="", every line of this string must be prefixed by indent
00363         // The last character of the returned string should not be '\n', even if it is a multi-line string.
00364         std::string str(std::string indent="");
00365 };

00367 class FiniteVariablesProductLattice : public virtual VariablesProductLattice, public virtual FiniteProductLattice
00368 {
00369         public:
00370         // creates a new VariablesProductLattice
00371         // perVarLattice - sample lattice that will be associated with every variable in scope at node n
00372         //     it should be assumed that the object pointed to by perVarLattice will be either
00373         //     used internally by this VariablesProductLattice object or deallocated
00374         // constVarLattices - map of additional variables and their associated lattices, that will be 
00375         //     incorporated into this VariablesProductLattice in addition to any other lattices for 
00376         //     currently live variables (these correspond to various useful constant variables like zeroVar)
00377         // allVarLattice - the lattice associated with allVar (the variable that represents all of memory)
00378         //     if allVarLattice==NULL, no support is provided for allVar
00379         // func - the current function
00380         // n - the dataflow node that this lattice will be associated with
00381         // state - the NodeState at this dataflow node
00382         FiniteVariablesProductLattice(bool includeScalars, bool includeArrays, 
00383                                       Lattice* perVarLattice, const std::map<varID, Lattice*>& constVarLattices, Lattice* allVarLattice,
00384                                                 const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state) : 
00385             VariablesProductLattice(includeScalars, includeArrays, perVarLattice, constVarLattices, allVarLattice, func, n, state), 
00386             FiniteProductLattice()
00387         {
00388                 verifyFinite();
00389         }
00390         
00391         FiniteVariablesProductLattice(const FiniteVariablesProductLattice& that) : 
00392                 VariablesProductLattice(that), FiniteProductLattice()
00393         {
00394                 verifyFinite();
00395         }
00396         
00397         // returns a copy of this lattice
00398         Lattice* copy() const
00399         {
00400                 return new FiniteVariablesProductLattice(*this);
00401         }
00402 };

00404 class InfiniteVariablesProductLattice : public virtual VariablesProductLattice, public virtual InfiniteProductLattice
00405 {
00406         public:

00408         // perVarLattice - sample lattice that will be associated with every variable in scope at node n
00409         //     it should be assumed that the object pointed to by perVarLattice will be either
00410         //     used internally by this VariablesProductLattice object or deallocated
00411         // constVarLattices - map of additional variables and their associated lattices, that will be 
00412         //     incorporated into this VariablesProductLattice in addition to any other lattices for 
00413         //     currently live variables (these correspond to various useful constant variables like zeroVar)
00414         // allVarLattice - the lattice associated with allVar (the variable that represents all of memory)
00415         //     if allVarLattice==NULL, no support is provided for allVar
00416         // func - the current function
00417         // n - the dataflow node that this lattice will be associated with
00418         // state - the NodeState at this dataflow node
00419         InfiniteVariablesProductLattice(bool includeScalars, bool includeArrays, 
00420                                         Lattice* perVarLattice, std::map<varID, Lattice*> constVarLattices, Lattice* allVarLattice,
00421                                                   const Function& func, const DataflowNode& n, const NodeState& state) : 
00422             VariablesProductLattice(includeScalars, includeArrays, perVarLattice, constVarLattices, allVarLattice, func, n, state), 
00423             InfiniteProductLattice()
00424         {
00425         }

00430         }
00431

00436         }
